intro: Blakea subconnata var. subconnata, commonly known as the red-veined evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety, dark green leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
